ActivateEventSource.name: ActivateEventSource
ActivateEventSource.description:
Activates a partner event source that has been deactivated. Once activated, your matching
                                                event bus will start receiving events from the event source.

CreateEventBus.name: CreateEventBus
CreateEventBus.description:
Creates a new event bus within your account. This can be a custom event bus which
                                                you can use to receive events from your own custom applications and services, or it
                                                can be a partner event bus which can be matched to a partner event source.

CreatePartnerEventSource.name: CreatePartnerEventSource
CreatePartnerEventSource.description: Called by an AWS partner to create a partner event source.

DeactivateEventSource.name: DeactivateEventSource
DeactivateEventSource.description: Called by an AWS partner to create a partner event source.

DeleteEventBus.name: DeleteEventBus
DeleteEventBus.description:
Deletes the specified custom event bus or partner event bus. All rules associated
                                                with this event bus are also deleted. You can't delete your account's default event
                                                bus.

DeletePartnerEventSource.name: DeletePartnerEventSource
DeletePartnerEventSource.description: Called by an AWS partner to delete a partner event source.

DeleteRule.name: DeleteRule
DeleteRule.description:
Deletes a rule. You must remove all targets from a rule using RemoveTargets before
                                                you can delete the rule.

DescribeEventBus.name: DescribeEventBus
DescribeEventBus.description:
Displays the external AWS accounts that are permitted to write events to your account
                                                using your account's event bus, and the associated policy.

DescribeEventSource.name: DescribeEventSource
DescribeEventSource.description:
Describes the details of the specified partner event source that is shared with your
                                                account.

DescribePartnerEventSource.name: DescribePartnerEventSource
DescribePartnerEventSource.description:
Called by an AWS partner describe the details of the specified partner event source
                                                that they have created.

DescribeRule.name: DescribeRule
DescribeRule.description: Describes the details of the specified rule.

DisableRule.name: DisableRule
DisableRule.description:
Disables a rule. A disabled rule won't match any events, and won't self-trigger if
                                                it has a schedule expression.

EnableRule.name: EnableRule
EnableRule.description: Enables a rule. If the rule does not exist, the operation fails.

ListEventBuses.name: ListEventBuses
ListEventBuses.description:
Lists all the event buses in your account, including the default event bus, custom
                                                event buses, and partner event buses.

ListEventSources.name: ListEventSources
ListEventSources.description: Lists the event sources shared with this account.

ListPartnerEventSourceAccounts.name: ListPartnerEventSourceAccounts
ListPartnerEventSourceAccounts.description:
Called by an AWS partner to display the AWS account ID that the specified partner
                                                event source is associated with.

ListPartnerEventSources.name: ListPartnerEventSources
ListPartnerEventSources.description: Called by an AWS partner to list all the partner event sources that they have created.

ListRuleNamesByTarget.name: ListRuleNamesByTarget
ListRuleNamesByTarget.description: Lists the names of the rules that the given target is put to.

ListRules.name: ListRules
ListRules.description: Lists the Amazon EventBridge rules in your account.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.description: This action lists tags for an Amazon EventBridge resource.

ListTargetsByRule.name: ListTargetsByRule
ListTargetsByRule.description: Lists of targets assigned to the rule.

PutEvents.name: PutEvents
PutEvents.description: Sends custom events to Amazon EventBridge so that they can be matched to rules.

PutPartnerEvents.name: PutPartnerEvents
PutPartnerEvents.description: Sends custom events to Amazon EventBridge so that they can be matched to rules.

PutPermission.name: PutPermission
PutPermission.description:
Running PutPermission permits the specified AWS account to put events to your account's
                                                default event bus.

PutRule.name: PutRule
PutRule.description:
Creates or updates a rule. Rules are enabled by default, or based on value of the
                                                State parameter.

PutTargets.name: PutTargets
PutTargets.description:
Adds target(s) to a rule. Targets are the resources that can be invoked when a rule
                                                is triggered.

RemovePermission.name: RemovePermission
RemovePermission.description:
Revokes the permission of another AWS account to be able to put events to your default
                                                event bus.

RemoveTargets.name: RemoveTargets
RemoveTargets.description:
Removes target(s) from a rule so that when the rule is triggered, those targets will
                                                no longer be invoked.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.description: This action tags an Amazon EventBridge resource.

TestEventPattern.name: TestEventPattern
TestEventPattern.description: Tests whether an event pattern matches the provided event.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.description: This action removes a tag from an Amazon EventBridge resource.
